Articles.Content:
Make it to the Mun with only RCS thrusters.

No using any solid, liquid fuel AT ALL.

If you can do this you are either the smartest person ever, or the luckiest person ever.

If anyone accomplishes this i will be suprised.

P.S.: As a bonus challenge, try making it to Minmus using only RCS thrusters.

O-10 or modded monopropellent engines (ie. RLA Stockalike) or mods with more powerful RCS thrusters allowed?

Since it's your first post here, you might want to check out the Challenge Submission Guide first.
Video of an old attempt at this.

Video of an old attempt at this.

That's an 0.17 video. RCS thrusters in 0.17 were a lot stronger then.

Current stock RCS thrusters (the omni and the 4-way) have such a terrible ISP that making it to LKO with them is already a challenge in itself. (And i'm not talking about bringing any payload) - you'll be already suffering very high part count

With the O-10 monoprop engine that's a completely different story - it's completely feasible - and it's not really difficult with the new way monopropellant is drained (current stage tanks are drained first)

Make it to the Mun with only RCS thrusters.

No using any solid, liquid fuel AT ALL.

If you can do this you are either the smartest person ever, or the luckiest person ever.

If anyone accomplishes this i will be suprised.

P.S.: As a bonus challenge, try making it to Minmus using only RCS thrusters.

can you use the new rcs thruster that runs of of lfo, but is horribly inefficient to cut down on part count?

O-10 or modded monopropellent engines (ie. RLA Stockalike) or mods with more powerful RCS thrusters allowed?

It's easy with these -- I just did it and accidently landed back on Kerbin with 2 km/s of dV left.

Up until .18, and then since .23.5, RCS thrusters have been physicsless, ie the game disregards their quoted mass and drag. This really helps monopropellant-powered ships, going some way to offset the low Isp and inferior tankage. The new O-10 engine is as suitable as any for a Mun mission, and even if you only use the classic thrusters it will still be perfectly possible, you'll just need a beefier first stage on the launcher.

...,you'll just need a beefier first stage on the launcher.

And probably a beefier finger that can stand holding H for minutes at a time...

The O-10 uses standart Liquid fuel controls instead of the RCS ones, including the possibility of throtle

TBH I already did a RCS only impactor to the Mun by accident in 24.2 . Just wanted to test a RCS propelled launcher and when I got to orbit I noticed I had enough RCS to get to the Mun ... so why not ? I assume that doing a RCS only shi to go to the Mun or Minmus will be quite possible based on that experience.

Not a very detailed challenge, but I'll bite.

This actually is not all that difficult now that we have the O-10 engines.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
I wouldn't include the O-10 in the "RCS" category just because it uses monopropellant

I wouldn't include the O-10 in the "RCS" category just because it uses monopropellant

But they're not specifically banned, either.

EDIT: and RCS stands for Reaction Control System. O-10s have reaction. They control the craft's velocity. Therefore, RCS.

In any case, using pure RCS blocks is theoretically not that much more difficult from using O-10s, as both are physicsless.

Edited September 16, 2014 by Vaporo

I assume that doing a RCS only shi to go to the Mun or Minmus will be quite possible based on that experience.

Yep. It only took about 10min to cobble a functional craft together for the job.
